sub_title: Adviseur Monumentenzorg en Erfgoed, Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds | Consultant | Researcher |
summary: Ervaren adviseur, onderzoeker en organisator met aantoonbare ervaring in de erfgoedsector. Ik ben een bruggenbouwer met een groot internationaal netwerk op het gebied van (archeologisch) erfgoed, erfgoed participatie en toerisme.

education.field_of_study: Doctoral Programme for History and Cultural Heritage

organizations.name: International Scientific Committee on Archaeological Heritage Management (ICAHM)

projects.title: Amersfoort Ontdekt
projects.description:
Amersfoorts erfgoed wordt aankomend schooljaar verweven met het geschiedenisonderwijs op de Amersfoortse MAVO Muurhuizen door objecten in interactieve vitrines in de school te plaatsen als focus voor les en gesprek. Door diverse thema’s en persoonlijke verhalen in historisch perspectief te bespreken en interactie met de lokale culturele instellingen wordt het geschiedenisonderwijs betekenisvol, meerstemmig en actueel. 

Initiatiefnemers: MAVO Muurhuizen (Dirk Willems) en AW Heritage Consultancy (Annemarie Willems) 

Projectpartners: Tijdlab, Museum Flehite, Centrum voor Archeologie Amersfoort, CollectieCentrum Nederland en Kamp Amersfoort 

Sponsors: Gemeente Amersfoort; Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds; K.F. Hein Fonds

contributors.headline: Adviseur Monumentenzorg en Erfgoed, Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds | Consultant | Researcher |
The past is a foreign country.

projects.title: 2018 ICAHM Annual Meeting: Discover Sicily’s Argimusco – a Holistic Approach to Heritage Management, Montalbano Elicona, Sicily
projects.description:
As Executive director for Friends of ICAHM I'm responsible for the organization of ICAHM's Annual Meetings that are organised in different part of the world each year.
The emphasis of the this Meeting was on: Climate Change and Community Engagement. Furthermore, we intent to organize sessions on: Heritage Tourism, the Africa Initiative and Archaeoastronomy.

contributors.headline: Adviseur Monumentenzorg en Erfgoed, Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds | Consultant | Researcher |

projects.title: MOOC Development Digital Humanities Course, Helsinki, Finland
projects.description: I'm member of a small team that is developing a Massive Open Online Course (MOOC) for Helsinki University. The aim of this course is to introduce humanities students to the online collections in Finland, the issues behind them (e.g. creative commons licensing, open data agenda), and suggest ways to use the resources for research.

contributors.headline: Adviseur Monumentenzorg en Erfgoed, Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds | Consultant | Researcher |

projects.title: 2017 ICAHM Annual Meeting: Sub-Saharan Africa and International Trade Routes, Bagamoyo, Tanzania, 2-5 October
projects.description:
As Executive director for Friends of ICAHM I'm responsible for the organization of ICAHM's Annual Meetings that are organised in different part of the world each year.
The emphasis of the Tanzania meeting was on: trade routes to and from Sub-Saharan Africa to the rest of the world, the Africa Initiative, and conservation and sustainable use of paleoanthropological sites. Furthermore we organized sessions on: World Heritage Sites as Sources for Sustainable Development and Digital Technologies and Archaeological Heritage Management.

contributors.headline: Adviseur Monumentenzorg en Erfgoed, Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds | Consultant | Researcher |

projects.title: Working Conference: Development and Best Practices Of (Archaeological) Heritage Management as a Course
projects.description: Together with Dr. Suzie Thomas (University of Helsinki) and Dr. Visa Immonen (University of Helsinki in 2017, now University of Turku), Aron D. Mazel (Newcastle University) and Tuija-Liisa Soininen (Pirkanmaa Provincial Museum) I co-organized the international working conference in Tampere, Finland, with funding from the University of Helsinki’s Future Fund. The conference aim was to identify and discuss the key components for teaching Archaeological Heritage Management (AHM).

contributors.headline: Adviseur Monumentenzorg en Erfgoed, Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds | Consultant | Researcher |

projects.title: 2016 ICAHM Annual Meeting: Archaeological Park as World Heritage Site - Management Strategy for the Future, 2 – 5 May 2016 Salalah – Sultanate of Oman
projects.description:
As Executive director for Friends of ICAHM I'm responsible for the organization of ICAHM's Annual Meetings that take place in different part of the world each year.
This conference capitalized on the work that was done at the International Conference on Archaeological Parks and Sites held in Salalah in 2015. Salalah was once a major node in the frankincense trade, and stands close to the Land of Frankincense World Heritage Site. This large, dispersed property highlighted the central theme of the 2015 conference – managing archaeological sites as parks and the tension between protecting integrity and public access.

contributors.headline: Adviseur Monumentenzorg en Erfgoed, Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds | Consultant | Researcher |

projects.title: Tagung Badekultur - Touristisches Erbe und kulturhistorisches Potential, 27-29 November 2014, Badem Switzerland
projects.description: Together with the association Archaeotourism2012 and the town of Baden (Switzerland), ArchaeoConcept organised this international conference in Baden from the 27th till the 29th of November 2014. This conference brought together archaeologists, historians, built heritage experts, investors as well as tourism and marketing specialists and managers of modern bath and wellness resorts. All the plenary talks were in some way connected to the case of the development of the historic baths of Baden, and each talk presented different points of view from different places in Switzerland and abroad (Bath (GB), Baden-Baden (D), Aachen (D), Budapest (H), Aix-les-Bains (F)) to better understand the potential of the baths of Baden. During the workshops, the participants exchanged ideas and advice on important subjects like the planning of baths, their economic potential, labeling and the value of this particular heritage.

contributors.headline: Adviseur Monumentenzorg en Erfgoed, Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds | Consultant | Researcher |

projects.title: 2014 ICAHM Annual Meeting: Universal Standards for Archaeological Heritage Management, Jishou, China |20 – 23 October 2014
projects.description: ArchaeoConcept was asked to organize the 2014 ICAHM Annual Meeting in Jishou, China. As the responsible person for international projects at ArchaeoConcept I was tasked with organizing the meeting.

contributors.headline: Adviseur Monumentenzorg en Erfgoed, Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds | Consultant | Researcher |

projects.title: Tagung Archäologie und Tourismus – Schweiz, 8-9 November 2012, Thun, Switzerland
projects.description: The first national “Archaeology and Tourism” conference, organised by “ArchaeoTourism 2012”, was held in Thun Castle on 8th and 9th November 2012. More than fifty participants, archaeologists as well as tourism specialists, came together to identify their common interests, explore their differences, and to get know each other better with a view to working together more effectively. This meeting was subsidized by the Federal Office of Culture, Swiss Tourism and the Swiss Federation of Tourism as well as by local partners such as Vivat and the city of Thun. The first two lectures, which introduced archaeology to the tourism specialists and tourism to the archaeologists, opened up the debate between both partners. Workshops then provided an opportunity for discussions on specific themes, such as the development of a language common to tourism and archaeology, and the need for a platform on which information can be exchanged. The final three lectures showed that archaeology and tourism already work together well, even though there is still much to be done in order to develop common structures, communications and training. The results of these considerations were published in 2013.

contributors.headline: Adviseur Monumentenzorg en Erfgoed, Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds | Consultant | Researcher |

projects.title: Faro Skills
projects.description: Since 2005 the Convention on the Value of Cultural Heritage for Society (Faro Convention) can be signed by the EU members states. This research project is on the skills that a heritage professional needs to work according to the ideas presented in this Convention and what the implications of the ‘Faro-approach’ are for conventional heritage management approaches.

contributors.headline: Adviseur Monumentenzorg en Erfgoed, Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds | Consultant | Researcher |

projects.title: Hygge & Heritage – World Heritage and Local Services Seminar
projects.description: For their 'World Heritage and Local Services' Seminar, the HUMAK University of Applied Sciences in Jyväskylä, Finland, hired me to help them with development of their program, format, themes, international marketing and the moderation of their Seminar.

contributors.headline: Adviseur Monumentenzorg en Erfgoed, Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds | Consultant | Researcher |

projects.title: Visitor Research, 'De Tijdtrap',  Markt Hal, Rotterdam
projects.description:
‘De Tijdtrap’ (The Time Stair) is a permanent exhibition in the Markthal in Rotterdam, showing the archaeological finds discovered during excavations conducted at the Markthal site. It presents the history of Rotterdam in a vertical exhibition alongside the escalator in the centre of Markthal which connects the hall to the four underground levels. The deeper the escalator goes, the more in depth the history of Rotterdam is presented in a number of displays with findings and models, accompanied by sound and images. 
To get a better understanding of the visitors of this exhibition, in coordination with the Tijdtrap Associaton and the city of Rotterdam’s archaeological service (BOOR), the Faculty of Archaeology of Leiden University conducted a research project.  The aim of this research was firstly to get a clearer view of the number of people that visit the exhibition and their demographic profile and secondly to gain insight into the appreciation of the exhibtion.
I was one of the researchers and co-authored the final report. The project was initiated by Leiden University, faculty of Archaeology and conducted with Dr. M. van den Dries and  drs. A. van Rhijn from Leiden University and students from the research group Archaeological Heritage Management from the Archaeology Faculty (Leiden University ).

contributors.headline: Adviseur Monumentenzorg en Erfgoed, Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds | Consultant | Researcher |

projects.title: Mapping Archaeological Infrastructure Suriname
projects.description: Late November 2016 AW Heritage Consultancy was part of a mission commissioned by the Cultural Heritage Agency of the Netherlands at the request of the Directorate for Culture in Suriname. The purpose of the mission was to to compile an inventory of the archaeological infrastructure of the country in collaboration with the archaeological field of Suriname and to assist in the development of a sustainable infrastructure for archaeological heritage management.

contributors.headline: Adviseur Monumentenzorg en Erfgoed, Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds | Consultant | Researcher |

projects.title: Preservation Museum Harbor Spakenburg
projects.description: I was commissioned by the Municipality of Bunschoten, the Netherlands, to map the funding opportunities on the local, national and international level for the activities related to the realization of the mission as formulated in the Master plan Preservation Museum Harbor Spakenburg: the sustainable conservation and preservation of Museum Harbor Spakenburg. I also consulted on the design of the organization for the implementation of the Master plan.

contributors.headline: Adviseur Monumentenzorg en Erfgoed, Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds | Consultant | Researcher |

projects.title: Heritage and Quality of Life
projects.description: I participated in a study that goes into the value of social utilisation of archeological heritage and heritage and quality of life. The study was done at the care facility for mentally handicapped people, Ipse de Bruggen, where recently the Limes Visitor Centre NIGRVM PVLLVM was opened that displays the Roman heritage that was excavated on their grounds. The integration of the archaeological heritage in the daily life of people with a mental handicap makes this a unique project. The longitudinal monitoring study to measure the effects was initiated by Dr. M. van den Dries (Leiden University) and also conducted by students (Leiden University) and  Tom Hazenberg from Advise Agency Hazenberg Archaeology.
